entry.title: Mckenna Grace (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mckenna Grace (pictured) has portrayed younger versions of Sabrina the Teenage Witch, Tonya Harding, and Captain Marvel?

entry.title: few-flowered sedge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the perigynia of the few-flowered sedge spring outward when brushed against?

entry.title: Anne Balay (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that historian Anne Balay wrote two books on oral histories from LGBT steelworkers and truck drivers?

entry.title: Source–Message–Channel–Receiver model (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to the Source–Message–Channel–Receiver model, all forms of communication are attempts to influence the behavior of the audience?

entry.title: Wu Xiaoyan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Wu Xiaoyan, persecuted because of her adoptive father Wu Han, committed suicide 13 days before the end of the Cultural Revolution?

entry.title: Skirt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the stop-motion lyric video of Kylie Minogue's "Skirt" was created using more than 1,000 still photos of her posing in a hotel room?

entry.title: Ade Surapriatna (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ade Surapriatna confronted a police officer who had ticketed his party's supporters for violating traffic laws at a rally?

entry.title: The Fortress Unvanquishable, Save for Sacnoth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lord Dunsany's story "The Fortress Unvanquishable, Save for Sacnoth" may feature "the most original method of dragonslaying ever devised"?
